```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(glmnet)
library(xgboost)
library(irlba)
library(stringi)
library(FNN)
theme_set(theme_minimal())
options(dplyr.summarise.inform = FALSE)
options(readr.show_col_types = FALSE)
options(width = 76L)
```


Read in the data

```{r}
sounds <- read_csv("data/CSVs/all.csv")
```

Create training ID's for the data
```{r}
set.seed(1)

sounds <- sounds %>%
  group_by(label) %>%
  mutate(rnum = runif(n())) %>%
  mutate(train_id = if_else(rnum < quantile(rnum, 0.6), "train", "valid")) %>%
  select(-rnum) %>%
  ungroup()
```


K-Kearest Neighbors; make the data matrix
```{r}
mf <- model.frame(label ~ harm_one + harm_two + harm_three + harm_four + harm_five- 1,                   
                  data = sounds)
mt <- attr(mf, "terms")

y <- model.response(mf)
X <- model.matrix(mt, mf)

X_train <- X[sounds$train_id == "train",]
y_train <- y[sounds$train_id == "train"]
```

run the model
```{r}
pred <- knn.reg(X_train, X, y_train, k = 11)$pred
# for (i in 1:length(pred)) {

#     }
# }
```

Show the error rate
```{r}
sqrt(tapply((sounds$label - pred)**2, sounds$train_id, mean))
```
